misconceptions.inferred_category_name: No clear notional-machine misconception (code matches correct execution model)
misconceptions.student_thought_process: The student believes they must use a nested loop where the outer loop controls the row number and the inner loop prints that many asterisks, then print a newline after each row.
misconceptions.conceptual_gap: There isn’t an evident gap here: this is a correct mental model for how loops and printing work in Java. The prompt string is just for the human; the height is read explicitly with nextInt(); variables don’t need “automatic updates”; no math-operator misconceptions appear; no argument-mutation assumptions appear; and no type conversion is being relied on.
misconceptions.error_manifestation: No error; produces the required right-triangle output for valid integer input.
